<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 183, 949, 195]]<|/det|> <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[47, 201, 80, 225]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 219, 165, 237]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 241, 179, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 279, 325, 294]]<|/det|> ## FURTHER MATHEMATICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 304, 369, 319]]<|/det|> Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[834, 305, 908, 319]]<|/det|> May/June 2025 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[840, 328, 907, 343]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 357, 395, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 386, 395, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: List of formulae (MF19) <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 419, 225, 434]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 294, 451]]<|/det|> - Answer all questions. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 451, 761, 467]]<|/det|> - Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 481]]<|/det|> - Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 481, 565, 497]]<|/det|> - Write your answer to each question in the space provided. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 497, 482, 512]]<|/det|> - Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 361, 528]]<|/det|> - Do not write on any bar codes. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 867, 545]]<|/det|> - If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 482, 575]]<|/det|> - You should use a calculator where appropriate. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 881, 591]]<|/det|> - You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 854, 620]]<|/det|> - Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question. <|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[91, 669, 214, 680]]<|/det|> ### INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 684, 388, 699]]<|/det|> - The total mark for this paper is 75 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 698, 730, 715]]<|/det|> - The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 76, 675, 101]]<|/det|>
1 Find the Maclaurin＇s series for \(\mathrm{e}^{\left(\frac{1}{x+2}\right)}\) up to and including the term in \(x^{2}\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 791, 91]]<|/det|>
2 (a) Starting from the definitions of tanh and sech in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 99, 580, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
\tanh ^{2} t+\operatorname{sech}^{2} t=1
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 105, 919, 123]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 382, 454, 400]]<|/det|>
(b) The curve \(C\) has parametric equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[295, 409, 704, 432]]<|/det|>
\[
x=\ln (\cosh t), \quad y=\tan ^{-1}(\sinh t), \quad \text { for } 0 \leqslant t \leqslant 1 .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 445, 322, 462]]<|/det|>
Find the length of \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 322, 91]]<|/det|>
3 The curve \(C\) has equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[377, 101, 620, 122]]<|/det|>
\[
9 y^{2}-3 \sinh ^{-1}(x y)=1-3 \ln 3 .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 143, 507, 173]]<|/det|>
(a) Show that, at the point \(\left(4, \frac{1}{3}\right)\) on \(C, \frac{\mathrm{~d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=-\frac{1}{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 472, 113]]<|/det|>
(b) Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} y}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}}\) at the point \(\left(4, \frac{1}{3}\right)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 545, 91]]<|/det|>
4 Find the particular solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 110, 609, 146]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} x}{\mathrm{~d} t^{2}}+\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}-2 x=2 t^{2}+t-1,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 160, 399, 189]]<|/det|>
given that，when \(t=0, x=\frac{\mathrm{d} x}{\mathrm{~d} t}=0\) ．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[973, 231, 991, 382]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 457, 91]]<|/det|>
5 (a) Use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[366, 109, 634, 151]]<|/det|>
\[
\sec 5 \theta=\frac{\sec ^{5} \theta}{5 \sec ^{4} \theta-20 \sec ^{2} \theta+16}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 121, 919, 139]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 74, 460, 91]]<|/det|>
（b）Hence，obtain the roots of the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[383, 101, 614, 120]]<|/det|>
\[
\sqrt{3} x^{5}-10 x^{4}+40 x^{2}-32=0
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 135, 471, 153]]<|/det|>
in the form \(\sec (q \pi)\) ，where \(q\) is rational．

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 71, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
6

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 91, 840, 594]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 607, 918, 638]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y=\frac{1}{x^{2}+1}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n\) rectangles

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 628, 214, 657]]<|/det|>
of width \(\frac{1}{n}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 665, 672, 682]]<|/det|>
(a) By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 698, 572, 743]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^{2}+r^{2}}<\frac{1}{4} \pi
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[891, 712, 919, 730]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 339, 919, 382]]<|/det|>
(b) Use a similar method to find a lower bound for \(\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^{2}+r^{2}}\). Give your answer in terms of \(n\) and \(\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 816, 496, 858]]<|/det|>
(c) Deduce the exact value of \(\lim _{n \rightarrow \infty} \sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{n}{n^{2}+r^{2}}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 465, 91]]<|/det|>
7 Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 111, 591, 147]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}-\frac{2 x+6}{x^{2}+6 x+5} y=4,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 166, 631, 183]]<|/det|>
given that \(y=0\) when \(x=0\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 74, 581, 91]]<|/det|>
8 (a) Find the values of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 95, 567, 160]]<|/det|>
\[
\begin{aligned}
\frac{3}{2} x+3 y+8 z & =1, \\
a x+3 y+4 z & =2, \\
a y-z & =3,
\end{aligned}
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 166, 410, 183]]<|/det|>
does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 445, 316, 462]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 468, 569, 526]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{A}=\left(\begin{array}{rrr}
\frac{3}{2} & 3 & 8 \\
0 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 0 & -1
\end{array}\right) .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 534, 918, 554]]<|/det|>
(b) Given that \(\mathbf{B}=\mathbf{A}^{-1}\), use the characteristic equation of \(\mathbf{A}\) to show that \(\mathbf{B}^{2}=p \mathbf{I}+q \mathbf{A}\), where \(p\) and \(q\) are constants to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 669, 97]]<|/det|>
(c) Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}=\mathbf{P D} \mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[430, 74, 567, 91]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 105, 918, 122]]<|/det|>
If you use the following page to complete the answer to any question, the question number must be clearly shown.
